title: Expand History Quiz to a 25-question set

requirements.text: Update the backend MCQ question bank to include exactly 25 MCQs for the Class 9 History chapter ‚ÄúSocialism in Europe and the Russian Revolution‚Äù, covering the existing topics (#russianEmpire, #februaryRevolution, #afterFebruary) with a clear easy ‚Üí medium ‚Üí hard progression.
acceptanceCriteria: Calling getQuestions() returns an array of length 25.
Every returned MCQ has exactly 4 options.
Every returned MCQ has correctAnswerIndex within the options bounds (0..3).
The returned set includes questions across all three existing topics (#russianEmpire, #februaryRevolution, #afterFebruary).

requirements.text: Ensure the questions delivered to the frontend are ordered from easy to hard (difficulty first, then deterministic tie-break such as question text), so the quiz consistently progresses easy ‚Üí medium ‚Üí hard.
acceptanceCriteria: getQuestions() returns questions ordered by difficulty: all #easy questions first, then #medium, then #hard.
For questions with the same difficulty, the order is stable/deterministic across calls (no random reshuffling).

requirements.text: Maintain the final score semantics of ‚Äúout of 50‚Äù when the quiz has 25 questions by updating backend scoring logic so the maximum achievable score is exactly 50 for a perfect attempt on all 25 questions.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting all correct answers for the full 25-question set yields a score of exactly 50.
Submitting all incorrect answers yields a score of 0.
The backend does not rely on a hard cap to force results to 50; the scoring model itself sums to 50 for a perfect attempt.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with all logic in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).

Do not modify any frontend files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or any files under frontend/src/components/ui.
nonGoals: Adding new quiz topics beyond the existing three topics already present in the codebase.
Adding new authentication methods beyond Internet Identity.
Adding real-time multiplayer, chat, leaderboards, or persistence beyond the current in-memory question bank.
